results.title: Royal parade
results.brief_description: The newly formed Royal Western Australian REgiment receives its new colors. Field-Marshal the Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, is present at the colorful ceremony during which the old colors are tropped through the ranks. The new colors are blessed and consecrated by the chaplains. His Highness presents the new Queen’s colors and new regimental colors then addresses all ranks. Finally the new regiment advances in review order and His Highness takes a General Salute.

results.title: Royal Military College
results.brief_description: On the site of a former sheep station now stands one of Australia’s most modern military colleges. Prospective cadets are expected to have had a sound secondary education, as the four year course is of University standard, and covers Engineering, Science or Arts and the theory and practice of modern warfare. Field exercises are part of the plan to develop initiative and leadership and back in the laboratories experiments are carried out on rocket propellents and explosives. Facilities for recreation are many and varied, and include a ski lodge and a fully equipped gymnasium.

results.title: Royal Flying Doctor Service: Broken Hill
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray, John Shaw and Ron Hannam
results.brief_description: Looks at the activities of the section of the Royal Flying Doctor Service based at Broken Hill in outback New South Wales. Presents a dramatisation in which a doctor joins the service and is given an introduction to the operational methods of the Broken Hill Base. The vast outback area which must be covered and the people who are the potential patients are made known to the new doctor.

results.title: Royal destiny
results.brief_description: A selection of newsreel shots highlighting the main events in the life of Queen Elizabeth II. Includes the Coronation of George VI; the return of the King from Canada in 1939; childhood scenes of Queen Elizabeth, war-time duty with the ATS; engagement and marriage to Philip Mountbatten; the Royal Canadian tour; departure on projected tour of Australia; return to London on the death of the King; the funeral of George VI; Trooping the Color; Royal Film Performance and the opening of Parliament.

results.title: Royal decade
results.brief_description: A review of some of HM, the Queen’s activities since her Coronation ten years ago. Scenes from Royal visits to India. Pakistan, Ghana, Sierra Leone, Fiji, New Zealand and Australia are shown as well as the Coronation itself, the Trooping the Color and the State Opening of Parliament.
